At a later date the comparison of distributions will be extended to include an inflation adjusted profits base, using the inflation accounting model described in Mayer (1982).
Financial years are implied throughout this and the subsequent paper.
Note that losses carried forward will be automatically recomputed and the correct time profile of liabilities simulated.
The subsequent movements in the graph reflect the increasing proportion of the sample suffering from tax exhaustion and thus the smaller number of firms that can claim the additional reliefs.

Two points should be noted. First, the inflation adjustment in subsequent paragraphs is merely a price revaluation not a full inflation accounting exercise. Secondly the graphs depict levels not rates of taxation since numerator and denominator of tax rate are price level dependent and thus partially cancel out the inflationary influences.
